intro: Leucomphalos libericus, commonly known as the European buttercup, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Leucomphalos libericus is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
